title: Romelu Lukaku to Manchester United? Everton striker's agent leaves hotel minutes before Old Trafford chief
text:
Romelu Lukaku to Manchester United? Everton striker's agent leaves hotel minutes before Old Trafford chief Lukaku is refusing to sign a new contract at Goodison Park Share Romelu Lukaku was all smiles in training (Photo: Everton FC) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Romelu Lukaku's agent Mino Raiola was spotted leaving the Manchester United team hotel today after the Everton striker declared his intention to leave the club. 
Raiola left The Lowry minutes before United's executive vice chairman Ed Woodward this morning. 
Jose Mourinho and his squad were also pictured as they prepare for their Europa League last-16 second-leg clash with Rostov tonight. 
Lukaku is refusing to sign a new contract at Goodison Park despite Raiola last month saying that the Belgian was “99.9999%” certain to extend his deal with the Toffees. 
Lukaku, who wants to test himself against Europe's best in the Champions League, hinted Everton's lack of ambition in the transfer market is behind his refusal to sign an extension, saying: "There were some players I knew the club could have got and they didn’t, and they’re playing in this league. Lukaku jokes with his Toffees team-mates (Photo: Everton FC) The striker wants to leave the club (Photo: Everton FC) Lukaku's agent Mino Raiola was in Manchester (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Ed Woodward was also at the Lowry hotel (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Read More Chelsea mulling massive £100m double transfer raid 
"I am not saying names, but they are doing well.” 
Chelsea are confident of re-signing Lukaku, who they sold to Everton for £28million in 2014, and are also targeting his teammate Ross Barkley in a £100million double summer swoop. 
Raiola also represents United midfielder Paul Pogba who continues to struggle in his first season back at the club. 
He was criticised for his role in Chelsea's goal in the FA Cup defeat on Monday after failing to close N'Golo Kante down on the edge of the box and allowing his countryman a free shot on goal which nestled in the corner of the net. 
Pogba was also castigated by Jamie Carragher and Frank Lampard last week, with Carragher describing him as a "liability" and Lampard branding him a "£90million problem". 
Agent Raiola made a huge amount of money from Pogba's summer switch from Juventus to United, with the Italian club claiming he pocketed £24million from the transfer. Like us on Facebook
